# PR Summary

Currently we use `git clean -fdx` with some exclusions to clean the repo. This means potentially destroying works-in-progress if they're still untracked files.

By instead using `-fdX` we can get rid of any files that are actually being actively ignored (which are pretty much mainly the build files we _want_ to be removing, unless there's something I'm missing) _without_ also removing regular untracked files that aren't being .gitignore'd.

Fixes #10021 

## PR Context

See #10021
